info.title: MariaDB SkySQL API
info.description:
The below documentation describes the API for MariaDB SkySQL, which can be used directly with any HTTP client (e.g. curl, Postman, language specific clients, etc.).

### Authentication
To authenticate with the API, do the following:

- Generate an [API key from MariaDB ID](https://id-dev.mariadb.com/account/api)

- Use the API key to generate a short lived token
    ```
    curl \
        --location \
        --request POST \
        --header "Authorization: Token REDACTED" \
        --header "Content-length: 0" \
        'https://id-dev.mariadb.com/api/v1/token/'
    ```

- Use the `token` field from the response in the _Authorization_ header for `Bearer` auth in subsequent api requests.


### Clients
Clients have been developed to simplify the usage of this API:
* Command line tool: [`skysqlcli`](https://github.com/mariadb-corporation/skysql-api-cli)
* Golang SDK: [`skysql-api-go`](https://github.com/mariadb-corporation/skysql-api-go)
* Terraform provider: [`terraform-provider-skysql`](https://github.com/mariadb-corporation/terraform-provider-skysql)

These clients handle the token retrieval step automatically, and only need to be supplied with the API key.





**Note:** The example values provided below, if used, may not return a success response.

get.description:
Retrieve the list of quota limitations currently in force for the user, as well
as their progress towards those quotas

schema.title: Response Read Quotas Billing Quotas Get

get.description: Retrieve a list of custom configurations owned by the current user

post.description: Launch a new custom configuration for the current user

timeout.description: Example configuration demonstrating how to tweak database parameters

get.description: Retrieve status and metadata for the specified custom configuration

number.description: The number for a custom configuration

name.description: The name for a custom configuration

delete.description: Delete the specified custom configuration and its associated data

number.description: The number for a custom configuration

name.description: The name for a custom configuration

patch.description: Update an existing custom configuration (e.g. provision more IOPS, change node type)

number.description: The number for a custom configuration

name.description: The name for a custom configuration

timeout.description: Example configuration demonstrating how to update an existing config

get.description: Retrieve a list of services owned by the current user

post.description: Launch a new service for the current user

standalone-power.description: Create a new service using a single node transactions topology in Power tier

get.description: Retrieve status and metadata for the specified service

delete.description: Delete the specified service and its associated data

patch.description:
Update an existing service name. Valid names may only contain lowercase letters,
digits and hyphens up to 24 characters in length.

rename.description: Change the name of a services

get.description:
Retrieve a list of IP addresses which are currently on the allowlist for accessing
the service and its monitoring system

schema.title: Response List Allowed Addresses Services  Service Id  Security Allowlist  Get

post.description: Add an address to the service’s allowlist

delete.description: Remove an address from the service’s allowlist

get.description: View the status of any allowlist updates for the service

Retrieve the default credentials for the service,
intended to be replaced by the user via a MariaDB client
Retrieve the current running status of a service (e.g. Running, Paused, Pending, …)

post.description: Alter the state of a service, (e.g. Start, Stop)

get.description:
Retrieve a list of available database service types to choose from (e.g.
Transactions, Analytics, …)

schema.title: Response Read Service Types Offering Service Types Get

get.description:
Retrieve a list of available cloud providers in which to host the
database

schema.title: Response Read Providers Offering Providers Get

get.description:
Retrieve a list of available geographic regions into which a database cluster
may be deployed

schema.title: Response Read Regions Offering Regions Get

get.description: Retrieve a list of available node sizes that may be used for the database cluster

transactions.description:
Deploy a cloud database for transaction processing with persistent storage,
replication, read load balancing and read/write splitting all configured
out of the box and ready to go.

analytics.description:
Deploy a cloud data warehouse for ad hoc, interactive analytics on billions of rows
with data stored in a columnar format on low-cost object storage and massively
parallel processing architecture.

foundation.description: Query for resources available in the foundation tier.

power.description: Query for resources available in the power tier.

schema.title: Response Read Sizes Offering Sizes Get

get.description: Retrieve a list of available tiers in which a service may be created

schema.title: Response Read Tiers Offering Tiers Get

get.description: Retrieve a list of valid topologies for a specified service_type which may be deployed

transactions.description:
Deploy a cloud database for transaction processing with persistent storage,
replication, read load balancing and read/write splitting all configured
out of the box and ready to go.

analytics.description:
Deploy a cloud data warehouse for ad hoc, interactive analytics on billions of rows
with data stored in a columnar format on low-cost object storage and massively
parallel processing architecture.

schema.title: Response Read Topologies Offering Topologies Get

get.description:
Retrieve a list of valid database versions which may be chosen for database
deployment

schema.title: Response Read Versions Offering Versions Get

AllowlistIPAddress.title: AllowlistIPAddress
AllowlistIPAddress.description: IP Address that has been added to the services network allowlist

AllowlistStatus.title: AllowlistStatus
AllowlistStatus.description: Status of the service allowlist to indicate if address changes are provisioning

ConfigurationVersionResp.title: ConfigurationVersionResp
ConfigurationVersionResp.description: GET Configuration Response nested configuration version

CreateConfigurationRequest.title: CreateConfigurationRequest
CreateConfigurationRequest.description: Request body to create a new MariaDB Configuration

DefaultCredentials.title: DefaultCredentials
DefaultCredentials.description:
A credential issued for initial connection to a database,
intended to be immediately replaced by the user

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Generic message body containing error details for failed requests

Provider.title: Provider
Provider.description: Cloud provider, e.g. AWS or GCP

Region.title: Region
Region.description: Geographic region, as defined by the providers

ServiceActions.title: ServiceActions
ServiceActions.description: Actions that can be taken on a services in a Task

ServiceIn.title: ServiceIn
ServiceIn.description: Request body to create a new MariaDB services deployed by SkySQL

ServiceStatus.title: ServiceStatus
ServiceStatus.description: Response body for a services status

ServiceStatusUpdate.title: ServiceStatusUpdate
ServiceStatusUpdate.description: Request body to update a service

ServiceType.title: ServiceType
ServiceType.description: A database service type, e.g. Distributed Transactions

ServiceUpdate.title: ServiceUpdate
ServiceUpdate.description: Request body to update a services - currently limited to name only

Size.title: Size
Size.description: Node size, as defined by the providers

Tier.title: Tier
Tier.description: Availability tier, e.g. Power, Foundation, etc.

Topology.title: Topology
Topology.description: Cluster topology valid for a particular product, e.g. Standalone or MaxScale

UnmetExpectationDetail.title: UnmetExpectationDetail
UnmetExpectationDetail.description: Message details containing unmet expectations from failed specs

UnmetExpectationMessage.title: UnmetExpectationMessage
UnmetExpectationMessage.description: Message body with details regarding failed specifications

UpdateConfigurationRequest.title: UpdateConfigurationRequest
UpdateConfigurationRequest.description: Request body to update a configuration

HTTPBearer.description:
- Generate an [API key from MariaDB ID](https://id-dev.mariadb.com/account/api)

- Use the API key to generate a short lived token
    ```
    curl \
        --location \
        --request POST \
        --header "Authorization: Token REDACTED" \
        --header "Content-length: 0" \
        'https://id-dev.mariadb.com/api/v1/token/'
    ```

- Use the `token` field from the response in the _Authorization_ header for `Bearer` auth in subsequent api requests.
